user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtList_Add:
```c
void UtList_Add(UtListHead_t *ListHead, void *Data, uint32 DataSize, uint32 Tag)
{
    UtListNode_t *TagHead;
    UtListNode_t *NewNode;

    TagHead = UtList_GetHead(ListHead, Tag);
    if (TagHead != NULL)
    {
        NewNode      = UtList_NewNode(Data, DataSize);
        NewNode->Tag = Tag;
        UtList_Insert_Before(TagHead, NewNode);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
UtList_Insert_Before(TagHead, NewNode);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation based on the shown fragment: UtList_Add calls a different function UtList_Insert_Before, so there is no direct self-call. An indirect violation would only occur if UtList_Insert_Before (or a function it calls) ultimately calls UtList_Add (creating a cycle). That cannot be determined from this single line alone; with only the provided code there is no evidence of recursion.
